'''Théodwyn''' ({{TA|2963}}-{{TA|3002|n}}) was the mother of [[Éomer]] and [[Éowyn]].

==History==
Théodwyn was a noble woman of [[Rohan]], the sister of [[Théoden]], and the daughter of [[Thengel]] and [[Morwen Steelsheen]]. She was married to [[Éomund]] of [[Eastfold]] in {{TA|2989}}. Her son Éomer was born in {{TA|2991|n}}, and her daughter Éowyn in {{TA|2995|n}}.

Éomund was slain in {{TA|3002|n}}. Not long after that Théodwyn died of illness. Théoden raised her two children after her death.<ref>{{App|Eorl}}</ref>

==Etymology==
''Théodwyn'' is [[Old English]] for "joy of the people".
